text: {"grade": 1, "reasoning": "The candidate answer explicitly addresses the need to structure the Liquidation Preference to avoid conflict with German law, specifically mentioning the GmbHG §30 (Capital Maintenance Rule) in the 'German law note' section under the Liquidation Preference heading. It states: 'Liquidation preferences in a GmbH are typically structured through preference share rights in the Satzung (§ 29 GmbHG allows differentiated profit rights) combined with SHA waterfall provisions. Ensure the Satzung actually creates a preference share class — a purely contractual waterfall in the SHA is enforceable between the parties but does not bind a liquidator or insolvency administrator.' This directly satisfies the requirement of the criterion.", "criterion_id": "c4f96b53-9042-4bb5-a7bc-9375c1bbbac7"}
